messages: e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:56): wonders why people are still proposing features...
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:56): it should be pretty obvious that the WG hasn't started yet...
150ca666565bfcb850b2e2ee3c0f0c64 (18:56): it should?
150ca666565bfcb850b2e2ee3c0f0c64 (18:57): there's a mailiing list, that's all some people need!
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (18:57): they probably don't realise we've already got a decent spec to start with
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (18:57): they probably think we're starting from scratch
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:57): most of the upload stuff he asked for is addressed iirc
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:57): except for uploading folders...
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:57): isn't sure how that would work
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (18:58): there should be a mandatory lurking period ;)
d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631 (18:58): i plan to lurk for about 10 years
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (18:58): We might have a WD by then, though. Better watch out
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (18:59): who would determine who has lurked long enough?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:59): once MS joins I expect HTML5 will be "officially" submitted in some form to the WG as potential deliverable and then we'll see what happens...
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (18:59): if it isn't accepted as-is, this group will no-doubt fail
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (19:00): depends on what MS does
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (19:01): lol
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (19:01): "This sounds like it's beyond HTML WG and into XForms? (Not sure the actual term, but this is more technical than just HTML.)"
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (19:01): waits for someone from the Forms WG to take this as an argument in favor of XForms Transitional
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (19:02): Next we'll have XHTML2 transitional (and the xslt way doesn't count)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (19:02): oh, maybe it's now time to say that Fools day is over...
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (19:03): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: there already is xhtml2 transitional
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (19:03): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: see the role module

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (19:03): I think Raggett's vision for XForms Transitional assumes a product class where even a single product hasn't been proven workable, so I think it is premature to standardize interop within the product class
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (19:04): nice point
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (19:04): -> food
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (19:04): 1) Rename HTML5 to XHTML 2.0 Transitional, 2) ???, 3) Profit!
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (19:05): What happens if XForms transitional is adopted, but it turns out the gap to XForms is too wide, and a new transitional is needed?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (19:05): then we'll have xforms transitional transitional
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (19:08): the gap to xforms will always be too wide. you can't have a transitional format that is backwards compatible and takes you closer to xforms
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (19:09): as far as I can tell, "Transitional" is marketing, politics or both
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (19:10): "XForms" in the name too
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (19:10): all the best technologies has an 'X' in their names
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (19:10): We'll have to hurry up the versions until HTML X then
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (19:11): to compete, we should call it "XWeb Forms 2.0"
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (19:11): it's a nice mashup of XForms and Web 2.0 :-)
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (19:11): But it isn't transitional
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (19:12): i've heard it being called "Web 2.0 Forms"
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (19:12): Web 2.0 XForms + AJAX Transitional
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (19:13): AJAXForms already exists, I think
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (19:13): http://ajaxforms.sourceforge.net/
